basics.name: Jerry Wu
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a computer engineering student at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in May 2017.

highlights: Teaching assistant for an introduction to programming class using C
Integrated blockchain technology with mesh networks to create a distributed supply chain with applications in reducing logistical costs for disaster-relief organizations
Assisted with developing a proof of concept in Java; implemented proof of work algorithm
Product development engineering â€“ scan team; tested die and collected shmoo plots; performed timing optimizations to reduce the time and cost of validating a unit
Developed a database viewer and uploader for .csv files using HTML, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL; implemented error checking on upload, significantly reducing the risk of bad data

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
